definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: Executor, Zeratul shall find us passage to the warp gate.
sentences.chinese: 執行長，澤拉圖會殺出一條通往傳送門的血路。

sentences.english: Pang is the chief executive of PEMGroup.
sentences.chinese: 彭日成是保盛豐的首席執行長。

sentences.english: Michale D. West is a president and CEO of Advanced Cell Technology, a privately held biotechnology company in Worcester.
sentences.chinese: 威斯特是先進科技公司的總裁兼執行長。

sentences.english: The board's vote to hire Ms. Dean as CEO was unanimous .
sentences.chinese: 董事會無異議通過聘請狄恩女士擔任執行長。

sentences.english: Mr. Cai will succeed Zha Xiangyang as CEO of the joint venture.
sentences.chinese: 蔡金勇將接任查向陽擔任高盛高華的首席執行長。

sentences.english: Anne Lauvergeon, chief executive of Areva, ranked 3rd.
sentences.chinese: 排在第三的則是法國阿海琺電力集團執行長羅維津。

sentences.english: Two CEO biogs stand out from the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 有兩家公司執行長的個人小傳出類拔萃。

sentences.english: Its chief executive, Qin Dazhong, was also previously at Li Ning.
sentences.chinese: 公司首席執行長秦大中之前也曾在李寧公司供職。
